item.title: How do I color this code?

@mr_extremez wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:10, topic:413417”][quote author=ExtremeX-Scape™ link=topic=514919.msg3738502#msg3738502 date=1315104618]
No not a memory leak…
I should explain to you in detail over MSN what they are…

But it does indeed cause memory to be used in the object, there is no need for 2 instances of ‘@red@’
[/quote]
lol.[/quote]
i was thinking the same.

item.title: How do I color this code?

item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

No not a memory leak…
I should explain to you in detail over MSN what they are…

But it does indeed cause memory to be used in the object, there is no need for 2 instances of ‘@red@’

item.title: How do I color this code?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Vhenom, post:5, topic:413417”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=514919.msg3738485#msg3738485 date=1315103820]

@red@ ? or

No sir, it’s #dre#
[/quote]
Actually “sir” (: its if(playerCommand.startsWith(“stafflist”)){
c.getPA().sendFrame126(@red@Rehab United’s Staff@red@", 8144);

The stuff in red is how you color it (: but thanks guys![/quote]
bro that causes tons of memory leaks, and lag.
this is simpler and does not cause lag.
c.getPA().sendFrame126(redRehab United’s Staffred", 8144);

Read full topic

item.title: How do I color this code?
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

This is my code

if(playerCommand.startsWith("stafflist")){ c.getPA().sendFrame126(" Rehab United's Staff", 8144); c.getPA().sendFrame126("Moderators", 8145); c.getPA().sendFrame126("OPEN", 8146); c.getPA().sendFrame126("OPEN", 8147); c.getPA().sendFrame126("OPEN", 8148); c.getPA().sendFrame126("Administrators", 8149); c.getPA().sendFrame126("OPEN", 8150); c.getPA().sendFrame126("OPEN", 8151); c.getPA().sendFrame126("OWNER and CODER", 8152); c.getPA().sendFrame126("Fernando", 8153); c.getPA().sendFrame126("Co-Owner", 8154); c.getPA().sendFrame126("OPEN", 8155); c.getPA().sendFrame126("-Donations can be made to be a Staff.-", 8156); c.getPA().sendFrame126("-One can also earn it-", 8157); c.getPA().sendFrame126("", 8158); c.getPA().sendFrame126("", 8159); c.getPA().sendFrame126("", 8160); c.getPA().showInterface(8134); c.flushOutStream(); }
How could I color the words? Like the ones that are red in the code?

Read full topic
item.source: How do I color this code?
